data.title: Cannot install/update VSCode to 9/8/2016 version
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run VSCode Installer
2. The following window pops up saying the installation failed, and fails even after 3 retries.

I got a similar error when updating to the latest version of VSCode and opened issue 11717 because VSCode would not start after the auto-update failed.  I grabbed the latest stable release installer yesterday and got this error.

![vscodeinstallerror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11397903/18393641/1142989a-766b-11e6-9bbf-a663905b61f9.png)

data.title: Cursor not between quotes after autocomplete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 and 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an html file
2. Type "<html lan" and then use autocomplete (Tab or Enter) to finish the lang="" bit
3. The cursor is now after the quotes instead of between them as in previous versions

I haven't checked this with other languages, or on other platforms.
I have no extensions related to html installed.

data.title: Syntax highlighting doesn't work with "text/babel" script tags
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 version 1511 (OS Build 10586.545)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a `<script type="text/babel">` tag in a .html file.
2. Observe that syntax highlighting doesn't work inside the tag as long as script type is set to `text/babel`. If it is changed to `text/javascript` then syntax highlighting works.

It is absolutely required to be able to use `text/babel` tags in some instances, e.g. when following the official ReactJS tutorial.

data.title: .CS file type description changed to "URL:vscode" after upgrade to 1.5.1 (or 1.5.0)
data.body:
It looks like the windows file type description is getting clobbered by the new version of VSCode. I had VSCode as the default program for .cs files but now the description has been changed to "URL:vscode"
This might have happened after the upgrade to 1.5.0 yesterday but i just now noticed.

- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Update to VSCode 1.5.1 from 1.5.0 (or possibly from 1.4.0 to 1.5.0

data.title: Can't debug node.js with `integratedTerminal` setting using MINGW64
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home Edition

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I have MINGW64 installed (the one bundled with the Git installer).
2. I opened my node.js project in VSCode 1.5.1
3. Set up a `launch.json` file as follows:

```
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Launch",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/index.js",
      "stopOnEntry": false,
      "args": [],
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "preLaunchTask": null,
      "runtimeExecutable": null,
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--nolazy"
      ],
      "env": {
        "NODE_ENV": "development"
      },
      "console": "integratedTerminal",
      "sourceMaps": false,
      "outDir": null
    }
  ]
}
```
1. When I launch, I see a MINGW64 window open up, the directory is set correctly, but it's not doing anything, just waiting for me to type a command.
2. After 10 seconds, the task in VSCode times out.

Things I've tried:
1. Running `npm start` in cmd.exe, or in mingw works fine.
2. Changing `integratedTerminal` to `"externalTerminal"` or `"internalConsole"` work fine.

data.title: Terminal API: Terminal object should include PID of the launched terminal
data.body:
The new terminal API is looking great!  It'd be really helpful to me if I could get the process ID of the launched terminal as a property on the Terminal object.  I need this information in the PowerShell extension to help coordinate with my debug adapter. 

Also: could there possibly be a promise return type from createTerminal so that the Terminal only gets returned after the process is started, or maybe a different way like having an event on the Terminal object that is returned?

data.title: SSL errors after 1.5.1 update
data.body:
**\- VSCode Version:**
1.5.1
**\- OS Version:**
El Capitan

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open Vscode and message is displayed "unable to get local issuer certificate".
2. Click close and open extensions panel and message is displayed "Marketplace returned 'ECONNREFUSED'. Please check the 'http.proxy' setting."

I had already set my strict settings in the prior versions to get around corporate firewall.

`"http.proxyStrictSSL": false`

Another person sitting next to me (with same system) also has this issue after updating to 1.5.1.

data.title: circular symlink breaks typescript intellisense
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Before creating symlink, intellisense works:
   ![good](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4246233/18388711/5364d6b4-7668-11e6-9b13-abc82cbc1849.png)
2. Inside some project folder, create symbolic link to parent folder
   `$ ln -s ../../ baselibs`
3. Restart vscode
4. Now intellisense fails:
   ![bad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4246233/18388847/d33a7542-7668-11e6-8a36-9efda1d7d19f.png)

My project folder has 16942 files and 2944 folders. I try to reproduce the issue in a simpler folder structure, but i couldn't. 

I also tried to ignore the symlink in the settings.json, but this doesn't fix the issue.

Gladly i'll provide more info.
- VSCode Version:
  Versión 1.5.1
  Confirmación 07d663dc1bd848161edf4cd4ce30cce410d3d877
  Fecha 2016-09-08T21:34:58.760Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Representador 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version:
  Linux os006724 4.6.0-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.6.4-1 (2016-07-18) x86_64 GNU/Linux

data.title: Don't remove extra spaces at the end of a line for Markdown
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1 - OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a markdown file with spaces at the end of a line 2. Save the file with "files.trimTrailingWhitespace" enabled The spaces will be removed, but for Markdown documents that shouldn't happen. From the [official documentation](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#p): > When you do want to insert a
break tag using Markdown, you end a line with two or more spaces, then type return.

data.title: Add folder icons to seti theme
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use the new seti file icon theme
2. Keep making mistakes due to the fact files have icons, but not folders, which makes files appear indented. This makes files which are siblings to folders look like they're actually contained within the folders, because they are indented by their icon but the folders are not. So using this theme makes things super confusing in the explorer.
3. Switch to a different theme because of this issue despite liking the colorful style.

tl;dr please add folder icons to the seti theme :) you could just copy the ones from the "minimal" theme!

data.title: Go to definition broken in latest version of VS Code (1.5) + older TypeScript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5
- OS Version: OS X Yosemite

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open up project
2. Click the cursor over a method
3. Click F12 to try to go to definition and nothing happens
4. Switch to using VS Code 1.4 and repeat steps 1-3 and everything works as expected

This feels like a really bad bug as it makes the latest version of VS Code pretty much unusable for me unless there is some workaround that I'm not aware of. Also, it would be nice if there was an official download source to downgrade to a prior version. Fortunately, I found one in my trash this time, but I will definitely be disabling auto update because of this for future releases.

data.title: Tab stops at user snippets not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:

User Snippets -> Javascript

  "Print to console": {
        "prefix": "x",
        "body": [
            "console.log('xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx',$1);"
        ],
        "description": "Log output to console"
    }
Pressing tab after x shifts cursor to the end of the line where as the desired place is $1

data.title: [themes] confusing alignment of file in folders in folder-less themes
data.body:
The Seti icon theme released with VS Code 1.5 does not provide icons for folders (open or closed).

This causes a confusing misalignment between the names of folders and files at the same level of the hierarchy, making the files appear to be children of the last folder.

Would it be possible to enable folder icons with the Seti theme?
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

data.body: Syntax highlighting associates with these extensions already. The icon theme does not yet.
